segment.source: How to Create a Connection Group with User-Published and Globally Published Packages
segment.target: How to Create a Connection Group with User-Published and Globally Published Packages

segment.source: How to Create a Connection Group with User-Published and Globally Published Packages
segment.target: How to Create a Connection Group with User-Published and Globally Published Packages

segment.source: How to Create a Connection Group with User-Published and Globally Published Packages
segment.target: How to Create a Connection Group with User-Published and Globally Published Packages

segment.source: You can create user-entitled connection groups that contain both user-published and globally published packages, using either of the following methods:
segment.target: You can create user-entitled connection groups that contain both user-published and globally published packages, using either of the following methods:

segment.source: How to use PowerShell cmdlets to create the user-entitled connection groups
segment.target: How to use PowerShell cmdlets to create the user-entitled connection groups

segment.source: How to use the App-V Server to create the user-entitled connection groups
segment.target: How to use the App-V Server to create the user-entitled connection groups

segment.source: What to know before you start:
segment.target: What to know before you start:

segment.source: Unsupported scenarios and potential issues
segment.target: Unsupported scenarios and potential issues

segment.source: Result
segment.target: Result

segment.source: You cannot include user-published packages in globally entitled connection groups.
segment.target: You cannot include user-published packages in globally entitled connection groups.

segment.source: The connection group will fail.
segment.target: The connection group will fail.

segment.source: If you publish a package globally and then create a user-published connection group in which you’ve made that package non-optional, you can still run Unpublish-AppvClientPackage package -global to unpublish the package, even when that package is being used in another connection group.
segment.target: If you publish a package globally and then create a user-published connection group in which you’ve made that package non-optional, you can still run Unpublish-AppvClientPackage package -global to unpublish the package, even when that package is being used in another connection group.

segment.source: If any other connection groups are using that package, the package will fail in those connection groups.
segment.target: If any other connection groups are using that package, the package will fail in those connection groups.

segment.source: To avoid inadvertently unpublishing a non-optional package that is being used in another connection group, we recommend that you track the connection groups in which you’ve used a non-optional package.
segment.target: To avoid inadvertently unpublishing a non-optional package that is being used in another connection group, we recommend that you track the connection groups in which you’ve used a non-optional package.

segment.source: How to use PowerShell cmdlets to create user-entitled connection groups
segment.target: How to use PowerShell cmdlets to create user-entitled connection groups

segment.source: Add and publish packages by using the following commands:
segment.target: Add and publish packages by using the following commands:

segment.source: Add-AppvClientPackage Pacakage1AppVfilePath
segment.target: Add-AppvClientPackage Pacakage1AppVfilePath

segment.source: Add-AppvClientPackage Pacakage2AppVfilePath
segment.target: Add-AppvClientPackage Pacakage2AppVfilePath

segment.source: Publish-AppvClientPackage -PackageId Package1ID -VersionId Package1Version ID -Global
segment.target: Publish-AppvClientPackage -PackageId Package1ID -VersionId Package1Version ID -Global

segment.source: Publish-AppvClientPackage -PackageId Package2ID -VersionId Package2ID
segment.target: Publish-AppvClientPackage -PackageId Package2ID -VersionId Package2ID

segment.source: Create the connection group XML file.
segment.target: Create the connection group XML file.

segment.source: For more information, see About the Connection Group File.
segment.target: For more information, see About the Connection Group File.

segment.source: Add and publish the connection group by using the following commands:
segment.target: Add and publish the connection group by using the following commands:

segment.source: Add-AppvClientConnectionGroup ConnectionGroupXMLfilePath
segment.target: Add-AppvClientConnectionGroup ConnectionGroupXMLfilePath

segment.source: Enable-AppvClientConnectionGroup -GroupId CGGroupID -VersionId CGVersionID
segment.target: Enable-AppvClientConnectionGroup -GroupId CGGroupID -VersionId CGVersionID

segment.source: How to use the App-V Server to create user-entitled connection groups
segment.target: How to use the App-V Server to create user-entitled connection groups

segment.source: Open the App-V 5.1 Management Console.
segment.target: Open the App-V 5.1 Management Console.

segment.source: Follow the instructions in How to Publish a Package by Using the Management Console to publish packages globally and to the user.
segment.target: Follow the instructions in How to Publish a Package by Using the Management Console to publish packages globally and to the user.

segment.source: Follow the instructions in How to Create a Connection Group to create the connection group, and add the user-published and globally published packages.
segment.target: Follow the instructions in How to Create a Connection Group to create the connection group, and add the user-published and globally published packages.
